content:
• Wednesday, June 27, 2012
  • LEU

    USEC (USU) provides an update on its FY12 outlook , saying it expects FY12 revenues to be $1.9B,...

    USEC (USU) provides an update on its FY12 outlook , saying it expects FY12 revenues to be $1.9B, which includes special items related to additional charges and revenues from its Paducah operations and divestments. Street estimates are for $1.5B. The company also says it expects gross profit margin to improve over 2011, and that its cash balance as of June 30 is expected to exceed $200M. Shares +27% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) gets hammered in the after hours session after the company...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) gets hammered in the after hours session after the company reported what it says were positive results from its Phase 2 clinical study of blisibimod in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus. Shares -52% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) -3.5% AH after announcing it has filed for a public offering of...

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) -3.5% AH after announcing it has filed for a public offering of 13.5M common units, with an option for underwriters to purchase up to an additional 2M common units. ETP says net proceeds will be used to repay debt and to fund pipeline construction capital expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • EGAS

    Gas Natural (NYSEMKT:EGAS), -6.6% on the day after news that Chairman/CEO Richard Osborne would...

    Gas Natural (NYSEMKT:EGAS), -6.6% on the day after news that Chairman/CEO Richard Osborne would offer 700K shares of the company's stock, bounces up 1.4% AH as the offer is priced at $10.10/share. EGAS says it will not receive any proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS): FQ2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $114.6M beats by...

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS): FQ2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $114.6M beats by $2M. Shares -3.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • EQM

    EQT Midstream (NYSE:EQM) closed at $23.55 per common unit, +13% over its $21 IPO price....

    EQT Midstream (NYSE:EQM) closed at $23.55 per common unit, +13% over its $21 IPO price. Analysts say EQM drew investor interest partly because its planned annual yield of 7% outpaces competitors such as Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) and MarkWest Energy (NYSE:MWE). EQT Corp. (NYSE:EQT), the natural gas producer that formed the MLP, +4.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) gets hit hard in post-session trading after announcing mixed...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) gets hit hard in post-session trading after announcing mixed interim results from its Phase 2b study of ganetespib, a treatment for advanced non-small cell lung cancer. The company says it plans to proceed to Phase 3. Shares -17% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • HAR

    Harman International Industries (NYSE:HAR) doubles its annual dividend to $0.60 per share, to be...

    Harman International Industries (NYSE:HAR) doubles its annual dividend to $0.60 per share, to be paid quarterly at the rate of 15c per share. The increase will go into effect for the new fiscal year, which starts July 1, and the first quarterly payment will be in September. Shares -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $420.7M (-4.7% Y/Y)...

    Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $420.7M (-4.7% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • BHC

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG) says it's received FDA clearance for VersaVIT, a vitrectomy system for...

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG) says it's received FDA clearance for VersaVIT, a vitrectomy system for the retinal surgery market. Shares +21% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • FLOW-OLD

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $63.4M (+6.6%...

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $63.4M (+6.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +11.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • NYT

    New York Times (NYT +7.6%) soars on news it is launching a free Chinese-language news site this...

    New York Times (NYT +7.6%) soars on news it is launching a free Chinese-language news site this week. The site will publish about 30 articles a day, with servers operating outside of China.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • SU

    Suncor Energy (SU +1.8%) CEO Steven Williams says the company is seeking partnerships with...

    Suncor Energy (SU +1.8%) CEO Steven Williams says the company is seeking partnerships with Chinese companies to help build its oil sands projects, as Canada's top oil producer struggles with soaring costs. "The availability of highly skilled labor is a challenge to oil sands, so we are looking at the option to help with that," he says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • ESV

    Ensco (ESV +2.9%) is "a great boring investment," Stephens says in initiating coverage of...

    Ensco (ESV +2.9%) is "a great boring investment," Stephens says in initiating coverage of the drilling contractor with an Overweight rating. ESV has the second-largest drilling fleet and the second-youngest ultra-deepwater fleet among its peers, and is on the tail of its expansion program while competitors are either just beginning or in the midst of their expansion efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM

  • Have a hankering to play the Obamacare ruling? It's risky, but if you must, here are a couple...

    Have a hankering to play the Obamacare ruling? It's risky, but if you must, here are a couple non-levered long-only ETF's ideas that traders are currently focused on: The Health Care Select Sector SPDR (XLV +1.1%) and the iShares Dow Jones U.S. Medical Devices Index Fund (IHI +1.6%). For the aggressive type, there are levered ETF's like: ProShares Ultra Health Care ETF (RXL +2.4%), or the Direxion Daily Healthcare Bull 3X Shares (CURE +4.5%). The tools are out there, how you use them is all up to you.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • NLY

    Investors pounce on 3 mortgage REITs going ex-dividend today - Annaly (NLY +1%), Capstead (CMO...

    Investors pounce on 3 mortgage REITs going ex-dividend today - Annaly (NLY +1%), Capstead (CMO +1.9%), and AG Mortgage (MITT +2.8%) are all sharply higher, nearly making up in less than a session all of the value erased from their stock prices due to the dividend payment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 10 Comments
  • SODA

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +4.1%) trickle higher as the company provides investors an update on...

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +4.1%) trickle higher as the company provides investors an update on the stage at the Oppenheimer Consumer Conference (webcast). Execs say that the initiative to sell products in Wal-mart is going well and will continue until at least the spring. In one of its slides, the company also dramatically displays how its margins increase over time in maturing markets as its product mix shifts into consumables.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • LNCR

    Shares of Lincare Holdings (LNCR +20%) surge following reports that suitors including Germany's...

    Shares of Lincare Holdings (LNCR +20%) surge following reports that suitors including Germany's Linde AG (OTCPK:LNAGF) are making a bid for the company, which provides oxygen and other respiratory services to in-home patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • GEVO

    Gevo (GEVO -18.9%) shares are tanking after announcing public offerings of its stock and...

    Gevo (GEVO -18.9%) shares are tanking after announcing public offerings of its stock and convertible senior notes due 2022. The maker of biofuels products plans to use the net proceeds to pay back part of its outstanding long-term debt, to pay the cash component to finish the retrofit of its Luverne, Minn., plant and to partially pay for the Redfield Energy retrofit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • OREX

    Orexigen (OREX +17%) is another benificiary of Arena's (NASDAQ:ARNA) good fortune today....

    Orexigen (OREX +17%) is another benificiary of Arena's (NASDAQ:ARNA) good fortune today. Contrave is an investigational medication OREX has been working on that also focuses on the treatment of obesity, however it's still in the developmental stages.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +9%) spikes to a year high on the back of the the FDA's approval of Arena...

    Vivus (VVUS +9%) spikes to a year high on the back of the the FDA's approval of Arena Pharmaceuticals' (ARNA +38%) weight-loss drug Belviq. Regulators are set to make a decision on its Qnexa diet drug on July 17.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 5 Comments
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +38%) resumes trading at $13.50 following the FDA's approval of its...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +38%) resumes trading at $13.50 following the FDA's approval of its weight-loss drug Belviq - formerly known as lorcaserin.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • ARNA

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -1.4%) are halted pending news that U.S. regulators have...

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -1.4%) are halted pending news that U.S. regulators have approved its weight-loss drug Belviq - formerly known as lorcaserin. The announcement is expected but notable nonetheless, due to the fact that it will be the first new prescription diet pill to be cleared for sale in the U.S. in over 13 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 12 Comments
  • ORLY

    Gabelli steps up to catch the falling knife on O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY -14%), upgrading the...

    Gabelli steps up to catch the falling knife on O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY -14%), upgrading the shares to Buy on valuation in an intraday research note today. The call flies in the face of cautious comments earlier by Nomura and UBS, who both warn that the auto parts sector may be running out of gas.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK -6.3%) continues to bleed in the wake of yesterday's Q1 miss, with the help of...

    LDK Solar (LDK -6.3%) continues to bleed in the wake of yesterday's Q1 miss, with the help of critical notes from Mirae Asset and Argus. The former points out LDK's Q1 gross margin was a stunning -65.5%, and expects its module sales to suffer from the November implementation of U.S. anti-dumping tariffs. The latter thinks the 2H revenue forecast implied by LDK's full-year guidance is unrealistic, given poor macro conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • TRP

    TransCanada (TRP +1.9%) confirms it has won federal approval to build the southernmost section...

    TransCanada (TRP +1.9%) confirms it has won federal approval to build the southernmost section of the massive pipeline it plans to supply crude oil from the Cushing, Okla. storage hub to Gulf Coast refiners. TRP needs permits from two other Army Corps of Engineers districts before it can start constructing the 700K bbl/day pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • SRCI

    Synergy Resources (SYRG +7.2%) is resumed with a Buy at C.K. Cooper, which says SYRG's...

    Synergy Resources (SYRG +7.2%) is resumed with a Buy at C.K. Cooper, which says SYRG's significant undeveloped Colorado acreage could turn out to be an extension to the Wattenberg Field, as industry drilling activity is moving in that direction. The firm says SYRG is trading roughly on par with proved reserve value, suggesting upside potential could be secured for free.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • DHI

    Fitch raises its outlook on D.R. Horton (DHI +3.1%) to positive from stable and affirms the home...

    Fitch raises its outlook on D.R. Horton (DHI +3.1%) to positive from stable and affirms the home builder's double-B credit rating. Fitch cited Horton's strong liquidity and product diversity for the move, as well as optimism about the housing sector. (text)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR -2.1%) shares drop sharply after Bloomberg says HNR won't solicit...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR -2.1%) shares drop sharply after Bloomberg says HNR won't solicit suitors to acquire the company as a whole. Shares had been up more than 5% as natural gas stocks rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY) +5.4% and recovering some of the huge losses it suffered on Monday...

    GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY) +5.4% and recovering some of the huge losses it suffered on Monday following bad news about a government contract. Today's rise comes despite S&P yesterday downgrading GeoEye's junk-level rating by two notches to B minus from B plus.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • KWK

    Standard & Poor's downgrades Quicksilver Resources' (KWK +5.2%) corporate credit rating to...

    Standard & Poor's downgrades Quicksilver Resources' (KWK +5.2%) corporate credit rating to B- from B, expecting weaker profitability and deteriorating credit protection measures for the oil and gas explorer. S&P says KWK is at risk of ongoing negative free cash flow, as it forecasts lower prices for natural gas liquids and lower production.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • LORL

    Loral Space & Communications (NASDAQ:LORL) soars 13.65% into orbit following its agreement...

    Loral Space & Communications (NASDAQ:LORL) soars 13.65% into orbit following its agreement to sell its satellite manufacturing unit Space Systems/Loral (SS/L) to Canada's MacDonald, Dettwiler & Associates for $875M. In Toronto, MacDonald, Dettwiler is +24%. Looks like everyone's a winner.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • CCC-OLD

    Calgon Carbon (CCC-OLD +0.9%) names board member Randall Dearth as its new president and CEO,...

    Calgon Carbon (CCC-OLD +0.9%) names board member Randall Dearth as its new president and CEO, effective July 31. Dearth currently serves as president and CEO of chemical maker Lanxess Corporation. The announcement comes a month after the maker of water and air purifying systems said that its Chairman, President and CEO John Stanik planned to retire to spend more time with his family. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (BTU +2%) tells analysts it is well positioned to navigate market challenges,...

    Peabody Energy (BTU +2%) tells analysts it is well positioned to navigate market challenges, capture opportunities and create value for shareholders in the near- and long-term. BTU now targets 2012 capex of $1B-$1.2B, down $200M from targets set at the beginning of the year. Despite declining U.S. use, BTU expects global metallurgical coal use to increase 25% by 2016.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +1.7%) moves higher this morning after being initiated with a Buy...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +1.7%) moves higher this morning after being initiated with a Buy at Maxim with a price target of $86.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • WATG

    Shares of Wonder Auto Technology (OTCPK:WATG +11.1%) and Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS +6.1%)...

    Shares of Wonder Auto Technology (OTCPK:WATG +11.1%) and Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS +6.1%) show strength after a tech deal between GM and Westport Innovations raises up investor enthusiasm for alternative fuel engines.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • AT

    Atlantic Power (AT -4.7% to $12.67) prices a secondary offering of 5.57M shares at $12.76,...

    Atlantic Power (AT -4.7% to $12.67) prices a secondary offering of 5.57M shares at $12.76, raising $71M. Atlantic will use the proceeds, as well as $130M in convertible debentures it's raising, to help finance a $470M wind farm in Oklahoma. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -3%) adds to the losses seen yesterday following its Unleashed event. Facebook's...

    Zynga (ZNGA -3%) adds to the losses seen yesterday following its Unleashed event. Facebook's mixed underwriter coverage, which includes cautious comments about its Payments business (heavily tied to Zynga), could be playing a role. The decline comes even though Stifel is starting coverage with a Buy and $8.50 PT, while suggesting the company could draw interest from a "strategic buyer" such as Google or Microsoft.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • CVM

    Cel-Sci (CVM +6.9%) CEO Geert Kersten drops heavy hints that the firm's Multikine treatment for...

    Cel-Sci (CVM +6.9%) CEO Geert Kersten drops heavy hints that the firm's Multikine treatment for head and neck cancer is performing well in Phase 3 trials. "Based on everything that we've seen in the clinic so far, if we continue to see the same results, we will have the first non-toxic cancer therapy," Kersten tells eHealth Radio.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • YNDX

    Yandex (YNDX +1.3%) moves higher on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at UBS, based on its healthy...

    Yandex (YNDX +1.3%) moves higher on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at UBS, based on its healthy growth profile and long-term partnership potential with global vendors. The firm lowers its price target however, to $24 from $25.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • JAKK

    Jakks Pacific (JAKK +0.4%) forecasts that sales of merchandise from Disney's (DIS +1.4%) Brave...

    Jakks Pacific (JAKK +0.4%) forecasts that sales of merchandise from Disney's (DIS +1.4%) Brave will be triple that of original estimates based on early numbers. A key to the boom in toy sales and the movie's strong box office showing is attributable to the warm reaction to Merida - the first heroine character to feature in a Pixar-produced movie for Disney.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • PNRA

    Shares of Panera Bread (PNRA -3.1%) hit the skids after ITG/Majestic makes cautious comments on...

    Shares of Panera Bread (PNRA -3.1%) hit the skids after ITG/Majestic makes cautious comments on the name along with its warning on Chipotle. The restaurant chain sits in the never-never land between casual dining and fast-food with analysts still trying to figure out if the stock is a defensive dining name as consumers tighten their budget or a pure growth play.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 3 Comments
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.8%) bounces on an upgrade to Buy from Guggenheim, which had downgraded...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.8%) bounces on an upgrade to Buy from Guggenheim, which had downgraded shares following the prepaid carrier's disappointing Q1 report. The firm likes Leap's recent decision to sell smartphones at higher price points, thereby reducing the frequency of upgrades (ed: this helps reinforce worries about diminished carrier subsidies affecting U.S. smartphone demand).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • CMG

    The lawsuit against Chipotle (CMG -4.0%) that traders are pointing to as a pressure point on...

    The lawsuit against Chipotle (CMG -4.0%) that traders are pointing to as a pressure point on shares alleges that the company doesn't "naturally raise" its beef and chicken as it advertises. On top of the legal action, and perhaps of more substance, ITG says the restaurant chain's Q2 revenues are trending below estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG -4.2%) fall off after on heavy volume after negative comments from...

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG -4.2%) fall off after on heavy volume after negative comments from ITG/Majestic take hold and chatter about the impact of a lawsuit in California makes the rounds. CMG trades below the $400 mark for the first time in almost two weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • UIS

    Unisys (UIS +5.6%) pops after receiving a services contract from the Department of Homeland...

    Unisys (UIS +5.6%) pops after receiving a services contract from the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) that has a potential value of $3B over 5 years. The contract features a 2-year base period and three one-year options exercisable by DHS. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +3.9%) signs a deal for Mid-Continent Instrument to distribute A123's...

    A123 Systems (AONE +3.9%) signs a deal for Mid-Continent Instrument to distribute A123's lithium-ion battery technology for aviation applications. A123 says that Mid-Continent has "extensive aviation expertise" and an "impressive customer portfolio." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -3.6%) heads south as investors who bid up shares on expectations of favorable...

    Facebook (FB -3.6%) heads south as investors who bid up shares on expectations of favorable underwriter coverage are disappointed to receive a mixed bag of ratings. Lead underwriter Morgan Stanley rates Facebook an Outperform, but its PT of $38 only matches the company's IPO price - analyst Scott Devitt (previous) predicts Facebook will post annual Payments revenue growth of just 17% from 2013-16, as gaming activity shifts to mobile devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 2 Comments
  • SKS

    Saks (NYSE:SKS) and Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) also fall under Citigroup's chopping block along with...

    Saks (NYSE:SKS) and Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) also fall under Citigroup's chopping block along with Macy's as the firm takes a dim view on prospects for the retail sector. Premarket: SKS -2.8%, JWN -1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMRN) +15.5% premarket as U.S. patent examiners appear poised to...

    Amarin Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMRN) +15.5% premarket as U.S. patent examiners appear poised to approve a family of key patents that could protect its AMR101 prescription fish oil pill from generic competition through 2030. Jefferies is bullish on the prospects for approval, reiterating its Buy rating on the shares and raising its target price to $26 from $24.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. futures are enjoying mild gains following better-than-expected durable...

    Market preview: U.S. futures are enjoying mild gains following better-than-expected durable goods data, with the S&P Benchmark +0.15%. However, as in Europe, where shares are also higher, the market is in a holding pattern ahead of the EU summit tomorrow. O'Reilly Automotive is tumbling 16.8% following a sales warning and is dragging down some of its peers. Later: Pending Home Sales
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • M

    Shares of Macy's (NYSE:M) move 1.9% lower after Citigroup slaps the retailer with a downgrade to...

    Shares of Macy's (NYSE:M) move 1.9% lower after Citigroup slaps the retailer with a downgrade to Neutral from Buy. Analysts also lower their price target on the name to $39 from $49.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • AMRN

    Premarket gainers: ENTR +25%. AMRN +15%. SUPN +8%. WPRT +8%. Losers: ORLY -17%. OMER -16%. CCG -6%.

    Premarket gainers: ENTR +25%. AMRN +15%. SUPN +8%. WPRT +8%.
    Losers: ORLY -17%. OMER -16%. CCG -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • OMER

    Omeros (NASDAQ:OMER) -16.1% premarket after announcing a public offering of its common stock, in...

    Omeros (NASDAQ:OMER) -16.1% premarket after announcing a public offering of its common stock, in part to fund the clinical development of two drugs now in late-stage trials. The size of the offering is not disclosed. As of March 31, the company had $16.8M in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • AAP

    Automobile industry stocks are on watch after a stark sales warning from O'Reilly Automotive...

    Automobile industry stocks are on watch after a stark sales warning from O'Reilly Automotive dampens spirits on the sector. The overriding theme from the trading action seems to be that consumers are buying new cars and won't be frequenting supply stores as much. Premarket: AAP -4.6%, PBY-OLD -3.1%, AZO -6.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • ORLY

    Shares of O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) sink 14.2% premarket after the company lowers its Q2...

    Shares of O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) sink 14.2% premarket after the company lowers its Q2 sales guidance. The company was working on the assumption that a warm winter had shifted sales into Q1, but weak sales figures for May and June now point to a larger trend as consumers increasingly buy new cars instead of fixing up older ones.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) +5.4% premarket on news it has entered into an additional...

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) +5.4% premarket on news it has entered into an additional agreement with General Motors (NYSE:GM) for a second advanced technology development program. The new program will optimize advanced natural gas technologies and applications for maximum CO2 reduction and fuel efficiency in light-duty vehicles.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) +1.9% premarket after announcing it has amended its $1.6B secured...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) +1.9% premarket after announcing it has amended its $1.6B secured credit facility, which will enhance its financial flexibility. The amendment provides ANR with a holiday from the maximum net leverage ratio covenant of 3.75x through 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
